Description: Green-blue glazed composition New Year's flask with round, lenticular body, short cylindrical neck, crowned with papyrus capital with incised details, shoulders elaborated with figures of crouching apes; incised tripartite collar decoration on front and back; the edge band is inscribed on either side with invocations to Ptah and Neith.
Curator's comments: Published in: Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, pp. 176-7 General information about New Year’s flasks: C-H. Blanquet, 1992. Typologie de la bouteille de Nouvel An. In Obsomer, Claude and Ann-Laure Oosthoek (eds), Amosiadès: mélanges offerts au Professeur Claude Vandersleyen par ses anciens étudiants, 49-54. F. D. Friedman (ed), 1998. Gifts of the Nile: ancient Egyptian faience. Pgs 229-230
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
